com.mapgroup.classificator.filemanager.reader

Class ArffReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapgroup.classificator.filemanager.reader.DataReader
      • com.mapgroup.classificator.filemanager.reader.ArffReader

  •  class ArffReader
extends DataReader
    This class represents a specific way to read ARFF formatted file.

    • Method Detail

      • getAttributeType

        private java.lang.String getAttributeType(java.lang.String rawAttr)
        Retrives the specific type name for the current attribute analyzed.
        Parameters:
        rawAttr - raw type representation for the attribute
        Returns:
        simple type name without any other useless character

      • initPopulator

        public void initPopulator(RequestStruct rs)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves all the information about the attributes type and the attributes name from the formatted ARFF file.

        The @relation tag was simply ignored during the reading process because was not useful to the learning tree process.

        For the continuos attribute no curly braces are specified when they are described, in fact only the specific type was needed. In this context 'numeric', 'float', and 'real' type will be mapped with the 'Float' java type.

        Specified by:
        initPopulator in class DataReader
        Parameters:
        rs - specific information about the current request
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • tupleFactory

        public java.lang.Object[][] tupleFactory(RequestStruct rs)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Generates the structured dataset parsing all the text which follows the @data tag of the arff file.

        The method automatically skip possible empty lines and got only the correct and formatted lines needed to construct the dataset.

        At the moment the '?' parameter that could be specified in order to represent a non specified and arbitrary value for that attribute was always replaced with '0'. Aren't considered this kind of type in the learning process implemented.

        Specified by:
        tupleFactory in class DataReader
        Parameters:
        rs - specific information about the current request
        Returns:
        read dataset structured in a proper way
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - if some errors ocurred in the reading process
